results.title: Spanking the monkey
results.creator_credit: Dean Silvers, Buckeye Films and David O. Russell
results.brief_description:
This black comedy was an indie hit for director/writer David O. Russell, with the content of the narrative, and the title of the film (a non-de-plum for masturbation) causing a minor furore. Ray, an introverted student studying to be a surgeon, returns home for what he intends to be a brief stay prior to taking up an internship. Upon his arrival however his controlling father presses him into caring for his physically compromised and emotionally depressed mother. As Ray assists his mother with her recuperation, their bond becomes incestuous in tone and increasingly bizarre. With an eye for the absurd and a heavy tilt toward black comedy, this film’s Oedipal overtone encourages uncomfortable audience participation in what is a rarely explored subject matter. The pathos of the screenplay manages to outweigh the mere shock value of the topics explored, and the film genuinely engages on an emotional level with an unusual coming of age story.

Credits: Producer, Dean Silvers ; director, writer, David O. Russell ; photography, Michael Mayers ; music, Mark Sandman ; editing, Pamela Martin.
Cast: Jeremy Davies, Elizabeth Newett, Benjamin Hendrickson, Alberta Watson, Carla Gallo.

results.title: Spanish children
results.brief_description: A rural family of southern Spain. Includes a trip by a boy and his father to a city market place and an evening at home to celebrate his sister’s birthday.

results.title: Spanish and Portugese explorations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Age of Discovery”.
Scenes of Spanish and Portugese towns and photographs of statues, paintings, and other material of historical interest are used to provide a background to the exploration of new routes to the Orient and to the New World. Reference is made to the voyages of Prince Henry the Navigator, Columbus, Vasco Da Gama, Magellan, the Conquistadores, and others.

results.title: Spain: the land and the people
results.brief_description: The film begins by describing Madrid, the capital, including buildings etc, then takes the viewer to Seville in the south of Spain. Maps indicate the nature of the country, consisting mainly of a high plateau. Products include port wine, oranges, raisins, leather, minerals, olives, olive oil etc. Glimpses are shown of a Spanish family at home and at work, the children at school, their games etc.

results.title: Spain: a journey with Washington Irving
results.brief_description: This film retraces the path of Irving’s original journey through Spain today. Includes visits to the bullring at Pamplona; the art treasures of the Prado in Madrid; La Mancha, the legendary home of Don Quixote and finally the city of Barcelona.

results.title: Spain: a Catalonian menu
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World of Cooking”.
People who live in areas with large Latin communities may be familiar with Spanish cooking. But the charming chef Carlos Sentis adds his personal touch and keen insights to the food of northern Spain. Includes the preparation of such Catalonian specialties as Sapa de Pescado and Chicken and Lobster Subur style.

results.title: Spain and Portugal on the threshold of success
results.brief_description: Shows the geographic features, natural resources, and strategic location of Spain and Portugal; investigates their struggle to become modern industrial nations. Explains variations in types of agriculture because of differences in rainfall. Describes such industrial centres as Lisbon, Oporto, Madrid and Barcelona. Discusses the problems of the farmers of the Meseta region. Shows scenes of Jerez de Frontera, Bilboa, Valencia and Seville.

results.title: Spaceship Skylab: wings of discovery
results.creator_credit: AV Corporation and United States. National Aeronautics Space Administration
results.brief_description: A documentary film on the Skylab Spacestation comprising a montage of still and live footage emphasising its scientific attributes. A giant solar telescope, Earth resources experiments, a materials processing furnace, medical experiment facilities, pollution research and observation and geological analysis all make Skylab an instrument of experiment and discovery.
